description:
## Theory
SIoTRx comes with several built-in functions inherited from FreeMarker. The use of them is with the ? char and the function name after the variable name. For example:
```
<#assign values=["a","b","c"]>
[=values?first]
```
 Here is a list with some of the most usefull ones.
 - [Sequences](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_sequence.html):
	 - [min](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_sequence.html#ref_builtin_min_max)
	 - [max](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_sequence.html#ref_builtin_min_max)
	 - [filter(predicate)](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_sequence.html#ref_builtin_filter)
	 - [size](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_sequence.html#ref_builtin_size)
 - [Booleans](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_boolean.html):
	 - [then(whenTrue,whenFalse)](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_boolean.html#ref_builtin_then)
	
 - [Numbers](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_number.html):
	 - [abs](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_number.html#ref_builtin_abs)
	 - [floor](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_number.html#ref_builtin_rounding)
	 - [ceiling](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_number.html#ref_builtin_rounding)
	 - [round](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_number.html#ref_builtin_rounding)
 - [Strings](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_string.html):
	 - [contains(string)](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_string.html#ref_builtin_contains)
	 - [length](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_string.html#ref_builtin_length)
	 - [lower_case](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_string.html#ref_builtin_lower_case)
	 - [matches(regex)](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_string.html#ref_builtin_matches)
	 - [replace(occurrence,string)](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_string.html#ref_builtin_replace)
	 - [split(string)](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_string.html#ref_builtin_split)
	 - [trim](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins_string.html#ref_builtin_trim)
	
[//]: # ()
To learn more built-in functions, visit the [Apache FreeMarker Manual](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/ref_builtins.html).
## Hands-on
### Task
Given the array *values* with numbers and strings:
	1. Print each string of values separated by a whitespace.
	2. Replace the coments with the statement print for the maximum and minimum number of the array.
	3. Apply to each number a transformation (absolute value and truncation) and print it with this format: *number* -> *transformed*
user_template:
<#assign values=["Hello",5,"world",1.5,0.7,"!",-2.1]>
<#-- WRITE BELOW -->
The max number is <#-- REPLACE -->
The min number is <#-- REPLACE -->
<#-- WRITE BELOW -->
solution_template:
<#assign values=["Hello",5,"world",1.5,0.7,"!",-2.1]>
<#-- WRITE BELOW -->
<#assign strings=values?filter(x -> x?is_string)>
<#assign numbers=values?filter(x -> x?is_number)>
[=strings?join(" ")]
The max number is [=numbers?max]
The min number is [=numbers?min]
<#list numbers as number>
[=number] -> [=number?abs?floor]
</#list>
expected_result:
Hello world !
The max number is 5
The min number is -2.1
5 -> 5
1.5 -> 1
0.7 -> 0
-2.1 -> 2
